title: Google shelves plans to add support for another private DNS standard in Android 13
content:
Android currently offers support for one private DNS standard — DNS-over-TLS (DoT). However, Google has been working on adding native support for another private DNS standard for a while. In September last year, we spotted a code change in AOSP suggesting that Google planned on adding native support for the DNS-over-HTTPS (DoH) standard in Android

The post Google shelves plans to add support for another private DNS standard in Android 13 appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Google has shelved plans to add native support for another private DNS standard in Android 13. Read on to learn more.
